Line 100: Line 100:  
::[[Brihadaranyaka Upanishad]] 1.3.28.
 
::[[Brihadaranyaka Upanishad]] 1.3.28.
    −
Wisdom in Hinduism is knowing oneself as the truth, basis for the entire Creation, i.e., of ''Shristi''.{{what}} In other words, wisdom simply means a person with [[Self-awareness]] as the one who witnesses the entire creation in all its facets and forms. Further it means realization that an individual through right conduct and right living over an unspecified period comes to realize their true relationship with the creation and the ''[[Paramatma]]'' who rules it.{{cn}}
+
Wisdom in Hinduism is knowing oneself as the truth, basis for the entire Creation, i.e., of ''Shristi''.{{what|date=March 2014}} In other words, wisdom simply means a person with [[Self-awareness]] as the one who witnesses the entire creation in all its facets and forms. Further it means realization that an individual through right conduct and right living over an unspecified period comes to realize their true relationship with the creation and the ''[[Paramatma]]'' who rules it.{{cn|date=March 2014}}
